sen.j: 家集（か-しゅう）は王朝和歌の世界において、個人または一家の和歌をまとめて収めた歌集を指す。
sen.e: In the world of dynastic poems, the Kashu is a collection of waka (traditional Japanese poems) edited from personal or family poems.
In the world of dynastic poems, a Kashu is a collection of waka (traditional Japanese poems) compiled from personal or family poems.
In the world of dynastic poems, "kashu" is a collection of waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) compiled from personal or family poems.

sen.j: 初期には子孫が先祖の家集を編むことが多く、自撰家集が盛んになるのは院政期から新古今期前後にかけてである。
sen.e: In early times, usually the descendants edited their ancestors' Kashu until self-selected collection of poems became pupuler from the Insei period (during the period of the government by the retired Emperor) to around the Shin Kokin period (around 1205 A.D.).
